job.title: Site Reliability Engineer (REMOTE)
job.industry: Computer Software,Information Services,Information Technology and Services
job.description:
Logic20/20 is looking for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer to join our team to support the development and operations of a large-scale application, running in Kubernetes and using Angular 8, Node.JS, MS SQL, C#.
The work will include both ongoing operational support and technical dept reduction.
Within the team structure, you will be increasing the system’s reliability, scalability and operational efficiency through automation.
In this role, you will use a diverse set of technical expertise; including back-end/ front-end development, DevOps tooling, troubleshooting and debugging skills, cloud computing, coding/scripting. Beyond your technical qualification, you will also have a healthy combination of cross-group collaboration skills, communication and relationship building skills.
Service Desk
Knowledge of incident management, release management
Responsible for analyzing and triaging user identified issues
Responsible for triggering first line services repair actions
Complete Root Cause Analysis (RCA) investigations
Responsible for communicating incident post-mortem process to TPM and stakeholders
Improve team practices in handoffs of work and incidents
Generate incidents data, including:
Recommendations for development team
Run-books for future incident response
New monitoring/alerting thresholds
Additional logging required
Experience with Jira, Compass, PagerDuty or xMatters
Monitoring and Incident Response
Application level monitoring: SPLUNK, AppDynamics
Infrastructure Monitoring: Grafana
Respond to automated reporting notifications
Resolve identified problems, notify stakeholders about progress
Escalate application issues not directly related to application
Responsible for creating, implementing, and monitoring alert mechanisms and thresholds
Backlog Management
Provide identified issues to team for prioritization
Update tickets based on progress and log final resolution s
Identify production issue patterns and propose solutions to address problems
DevOps
Hands-on experience with GitLab
Experience with Kubernetes, Mesos and Marathon
Some knowledge/experience with microservices and use of containers
Administration
Support access administration
Maintain and manage security and access to the application
Maintain Kubernetes, GitLab CI/CD pipeline, including capacity management
Development
3-5 years of Database Experience: MS SQL: building stored procedures, troubleshooting query execution, analyzing data flow
3-5 years software development experience with C#, Angular 8, and Node.JS
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related software engineering field or equivalent practical experience
Experience implementing test automation
Experience working with Azure
Communication
Good communication skills (both verbal and written) are essential
Self-started capable of dealing with ambiguity and minimally defined requirements
Comfortable talking about technical things with business people and business things with technical people. Able to express complex concepts in plain language to reach broader audiences
Ability to craft a compelling message and tailor it for a given audience. Ability to mix deep technical expertise with simple, everyday language to deliver a story that is memorable and useful
Do you also have a demonstrated ability to learn new technical concepts, combined with a high degree of intellectual curiosity? Come join us...
About Logic20/20. . .
Logic20/20 is one of Seattle’s fastest-growing consulting firms. We hire remarkable people to create simple, efficient solutions for complex problems.
Although we make it look like magic, our success is due to our approach (methodical and structured) and the people we hire (smart, motivated, and team oriented). Together, these enable us to consistently exceed client expectations—and our reputation is growing.
For the past five years, we’ve placed in the top ten of Seattle Business magazine’s “Best Companies to Work For”. From engaged leadership and wide-ranging benefits to career mentorship and diverse internal opportunities, we pride ourselves on being one of the best companies to work with and work for.
We hire people that are self-motivated, comfortable conceiving strategies on the fly, and enjoy working individually and as part of a team. Our work is high-energy and demanding, but new hires will quickly feel at home among colleagues as friendly and focused as they are. We bring our best to every opportunity, driving change in industries across the West Coast. Join us and you can, too.
